name: K2-178
scenarioDescription:
The K2-178 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-178 is a star with 0.95 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.89 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

K2-178 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-178 system


K2-178 b

K2-178 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-178 b is 12.402 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-178 b is 3.558 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-178 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-178, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
